application.doc: Retrieving a specific configuration entry - Reverse Proxy

param.name: id
param.doc: Name of the instance to act on, which is a unique name that identifies the instance

param.name: stanza_id
param.doc: The name of the resource stanza entry. For example, "server". Note: This name cannot contain the string "/entry_name" unless it is the start of the stanza name. ie "/entry_name/name" is valid but "/name/entry_name" is not.

param.name: entry_id
param.doc: The name of the configuration entry. For example, https. Note: This name cannot contain the string "/value" unless it is the start of the entry name. ie "/value/name" is valid but "/name/value" is not.

method.name: GET
method.id: Retrieve specific configuration entries - Reverse Proxy Instances
method.doc: To retrieve a specific configuration entry with the RESTful web service, issue an HTTP GET command on the configuration entry management URI.

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

response.doc: There is a problem with the request. The JSON message describes the problem.
File not Found, The requested service does not exist. The JSON message indicates which resource.
An internal error occurred. The JSON message indicates the problem.

param.name: entryName
param.doc: entry name and the entry values with this format, entryName: ["entry_value", "entry_value2", "entry_value3"]
